entry.title: NINE ALREADY RUNNING FOR THREE DOUGLAS COUNTY COMMISSIONER POSITIONS
entry.summary: December 1, 2025 3:50 a.m. Nine people are already running for three positions on the Douglas County Board of Commissioners, in the May 2026 Primary Election. The filing period opened September 11th. Incumbent commissioners Tim Freeman, Chris Boice and Tom Kress all filed for re-election on the first day they could file. Freeman is being...

entry.title: WINSTON CITY COUNCIL/URBAN RENEWAL AGENCY MEETING MONDAY
entry.summary: December 1, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Winston City Council and the Urban Renewal Agency will have meetings on Monday night at 7:00 p.m. Councilors will consider approving new business licenses for three businesses in the community. They will vote on a resolution declaring a Kubota Tractor to be surplus and directing that it be sold...

entry.title: HIV ALLIANCE COMMEMORATES WORLD AIDS DAY ON MONDAY
entry.summary: December 1, 2025 3:20 a.m. The HIV Alliance is commemorating World AID Day with events around the region, including one in Roseburg on Monday night. The Oregon-based nonprofit HIV Alliance is having the events to show solidarity, remembrance, raise awareness and provide a call of support for those impacted by HIV/AIDS. Through this shared resilience...

entry.title: A Night of Light and Community: Douglas County Gathers for the 42nd Annual Courthouse Tree Lighting
entry.summary: The 42nd Annual Christmas Tree Lighting filled the Douglas County Courthouse lawn with warmth, cheers, and hometown spirit as families gathered to welcome the holiday season.

entry.title: Stuff N' Things Opens in Myrtle Creek with Deep Community History
entry.summary: Stuff N' Things has opened in Myrtle Creek, bringing back a beloved local tradition of antiques and vintage finds. Owner Brittany is continuing her family’s legacy and invites the community to stop by the new shop next to Ray’s.

entry.title: UACT embraces holiday chaos with 'Have Yourself a Crazy Little Christmas'
entry.summary: For many, Christmas is a time for gathering, family, giving and joy. For the Crowder family, it's also a time for drama, chaos and chasing down a loose pet ferret.

entry.title: Douglas County Fairgrounds temporarily closes riding arenas to prevent spread of equine herpes
entry.summary: In the cold and wet winter months, indoor facilities provide equestrians with a way to socialize and stay active with their horses. But in Douglas County, those equestrians may have to wait.

entry.title: DEQ fines Douglas County $35,270 for methane violations at Roseburg Landfill
entry.summary: DEQ issued Douglas County a $35,270 penalty for failing to conduct required methane monitoring at the Roseburg Landfill from 2022 to 2024. Regulators say the lapse is a serious violation that delayed safety checks and gave the county an economic advantage by avoiding monitoring costs.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 11.28.25
entry.summary: Wendi Patterson Communication Director for the Roseburg Stake – Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints, and Colleen May-Weir of the United Community Action Network, talk about the Giving Machine at Valley River Center in Eugene, and the impact it can have on a number of charities, including several in Douglas County like UCAN.

entry.summary: November 28, 2025 10:50 a.m. The City of Sutherlin’s annual Christmas Tree lighting will take place on Sunday night at 5:00 p.m. The event will be held in Central Park. It is happening earlier than in past years, to allow the tree lights to brighten the downtown area throughout the month of December. ...

entry.title: Two meteor showers in December

entry.title: Ask a Master Gardener: What's a strawberry tree?
entry.summary: Question: A friend was telling me they had a strawberry tree growing in their garden. I’d never heard of such a thing — can strawberries grow on trees?

entry.title: FREE FISHING DAYS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AROUND OREGON
entry.summary: November 26, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife has free fishing days around Oregon, Friday and Saturday. That means both Oregon residents and non-residents can fish, crab, and clam for free.
